required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Open Label, Multicenter, Real World Practice of Durvalumab in Lung Cancer (Imfinzi PMS)
clinical_study.official_title: Open Label, Multicenter, Real World Practice of Durvalumab in Lung Cancer (Imfinzi PMS)

brief_summary.textblock: The objectives of this study are to assess safety and efficacy of Imfinzi (durvalumab) in a real world setting in patients with non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) or SCLC treated with Imfinzi under the approved indication in Korea.

detailed_description.textblock:
Primary objective : To assess safety of Imfinzi for patients with NSCLC or SCLC treated with Imfinzi under the approved indication in Korea
Outcome Measure:
- Safety (adverse event (AE), serious adverse events (SAE), adverse drug reaction (ADR), serious adverse drug reaction (SADR), adverse events of special interest (AESI), adverse events leading to discontinuation (DAE), and adverse events leading to deaths (fatal AE))
- Dose interruptions
- Duration of treatment
- Reason for treatment discontinuation Secondary objective: To assess efficacy of Imfinzi for patients with NSCLC or SCLC treated with Imfinzi under the approved indication in Korea
Outcome Measure:
- Progression free survival (PFS)
- Objective response rate (ORR)
- Duration of response (DoR)

primary_outcome.measure: Safety (AE, SAE, ADR, SADR, AESI, DAE, fatal AE)
primary_outcome.time_frame: for up to 1 year after the first dose of Imfinzi
for up to 1 year after the first dose of Imfinzi
for up to 1 year after the first dose of Imfinzi

secondary_outcome.time_frame: for up to 1 year after the first dose of Imfinzi
for up to 1 year after the first dose of Imfinzi
for up to 1 year after the first dose of Imfinzi

study_pop.textblock: Imfinzi treatment according to the approved label

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Eligible for Imfinzi treatment according to the approved label; patients with NSCLC or SCLC
- Provision of signed and dated written informed consent by the patient or legally acceptable representative
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of hypersensitivity to excipients of Imfinzi or to drugs with a similar chemical structure or class to Imfinzi
- Prior exposure to any anti-PD-1 or anti-PD-L1 inhibitors, including Imfinzi
- Pregnancy and/or breast feeding
- Current participation in any interventional trial
- Other off-label indications according to the approved label

patient_data.ipd_description: Qualified researchers can request access to anonymized individual patient-level data from AstraZeneca group of companies sponsored clinical trials via the request portal. All request will be evaluated as per the AZ disclosure commitment: https://astrazenecagrouptrials.pharmacm.com/ST/Submission/Disclosure. Yes, indicates that AZ are accepting requests for IPD, but this does not mean all requests will be shared
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: AstraZeneca will meet or exceed data availability as per the commitments made to the EFPIA Pharma Data Sharing Principles. For details of our timelines, please rerefer to our disclosure commitment at https://astrazenecagrouptrials.pharmacm.com/ST/Submission/Disclosure.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: When a request has been approved AstraZeneca will provide access to the deidentified individual patient-level data in an approved sponsored tool . Signed Data Sharing Agreement (non-negotiable contract for data accessors) must be in place before accessing requested information. Additionally, all users will need to accept the terms and conditions of the SAS MSE to gain access. For additional details, please review the Disclosure Statements at https://astrazenecagrouptrials.pharmacm.com/ST/Submission/Disclosure.
